article.info_title: Bing Preview Release Notes: Formatting Improvements and Image Creator Language Support
article.info_description: We’re excited about yesterday’s announcement regarding new features coming to chat in Bing and Edge, including the removal of the waitlist to access the Open Preview.  Over the next few weeks, you may see us temporarily experiment with some of these new features.  We’ll continue to use these Release Notes to update you on which features are fully available to all users.

article.info_title: Announcing the Next Wave of AI Innovation with Microsoft Bing and Edge
article.info_description: Just three months ago, we unveiled the new AI-powered Microsoft Bing and Edge to reinvent the future of search with your copilot for the web. Today I’m thrilled to announce that we are moving to the next generation of AI-powered Bing and Edge to transform the largest category of software in the world – search – by greatly expanding the vision and capabilities we think of as Your Copilot for the Web.

article.info_title: Bing Preview Release Notes: Travel and Recipe Grounding Improvements
article.info_description: This week, we’re excited about the announcement that Microsoft Designer has expanded its public preview and added new AI features.  Designer uses our latest generative AI models to help you create graphics and visual content.

article.info_title: Bing Preview Release Notes: LaTeX Support in Bing Chat
article.info_description:
Last week, we announced updates to SwiftKey and other mobile apps that bring Bing chat to your fingertips in ways that improve your productivity.  We’re also excited about yesterday’s announcement that Copilot is coming to Microsoft Viva. 

Here’s a summary of what else has changed in Bing chat since our April 7 update.

article.info_title: The role of page experience in creating helpful content
article.info_description:
Helpful content generally offers a good page experience. That's why today, we've added a
      section on page experience to our guidance on creating helpful content and revised our
      help page about page experience.

You can now create custom funnel reports, enabling you to see the steps users take to complete a task and evaluate how many users drop off between each step. This update gives you the flexibility to create relevant funnels for your specific business purposes and reference the information in Reports. Learn more

We fixed an issue that prevented users from connecting to PostgreSQL version 14.
Public issue tracker.

In Google Analytics 4 properties, the Home page includes the following new enhancements:

Server-side tagging: You can now use geo location information when serving scripts from the first party. This allows you to implement features such as advanced consent mode without passing an IP address to Google. Learn more.

article.info_title: #GTMTips: Prevent SGTM From Setting The FPID Cookie
article.info_description:
The FPID cookie is what server-side Google Tag Manager would prefer to use for your Google Analytics 4 tracking.
It’s a cookie set in the HTTP response from the server, and it’s flagged as HttpOnly, which means it’s only accessible by a web server running on the domain on which it was set.
There’s nothing wrong with the technology, and I do recommend that server-side setups toggle it on by default.
